main_definition: To join together in marriage or a formal partnership.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Formal union of two people, typically through marriage
meanings_and_examples.example: The couple exchanged vows and were wed on their beach ceremony.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To connect or link together firmly
meanings_and_examples.example: After years of being friends, they finally decided to wedge their lives together in a committed relationship.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An informal way of saying that something is connected or related
meanings_and_examples.example: The success of the new policy was wed to the cooperation of all departments within the company.
